intro: Staurogyne letestuana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf waterhyssop, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshy areas and along riverbanks. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in whorls along the stem, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Staurogyne letestuana plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
